title: Configure Client Services
description: CIS Ubuntu Linux 24.04 LTS Benchmark - Section 2.2: Configure Client Services

controls.title: Ensure NIS Client is not installed
controls.description: The Network Information Service (NIS), formerly known as Yellow Pages, is a client-server directory service protocol used to distribute system configuration files.
controls.impact: The NIS service is inherently an insecure system that has been vulnerable to DOS attacks, buffer overflows and has poor authentication for querying NIS maps.

controls.title: Ensure rsh client is not installed
controls.description: The rsh package contains the client commands for the rsh services.
controls.impact: These legacy clients contain numerous security exposures and have been replaced with the more secure SSH package.

controls.title: Ensure talk client is not installed
controls.description: The talk software makes it possible for users to send and receive messages across systems through a terminal session.
controls.impact: The software presents a security risk as it uses unencrypted protocols for communication.

controls.title: Ensure telnet client is not installed
controls.description: The telnet package contains the telnet client, which allows users to start connections to other systems via the telnet protocol.
controls.impact: The telnet protocol is insecure and unencrypted. The use of an unencrypted transmission medium could allow an unauthorized user to steal credentials.

controls.title: Ensure ldap client is not installed
controls.description: The Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) was introduced as a replacement for NIS/YP.
controls.impact: If the system will not need to act as an LDAP client, it is recommended that the software be removed to reduce the potential attack surface.

controls.title: Ensure ftp client is not installed
controls.description: The ftp package provides the ftp client utility.
controls.impact: FTP does not protect the confidentiality of data or authentication credentials. It is recommended sftp be used if file transfer is required.
